description:
Why Work for KeHE?
• Full-time
• Pay Range: $99,400.00/Yr. - $145,750.00/Yr.
• Shift Days: , Shift Time:
• Benefits on Day 1
• Health/Rx
• Dental
• Vision
• Flexible and health spending accounts (FSA/HSA)
• Supplemental life insurance
• 401(k)
• Paid time off
• Paid sick time
• Short term & long term disability coverage (STD/LTD)
• Employee stock ownership (ESOP)
• Holiday pay for company designated holidays

Overview
Good people, working with good people, for our common good.
Sound good?
KeHE-a natural, organic, specialty and fresh food distributor-is all about "good" and is growing, so there's never been a more exciting time to join our team. If you're enthusiastic about working in an environment with a people-first culture and an organization committed to good living, good food and good service, we'd love to talk to you!
Primary Responsibilities
The Director of Business Development is responsible for significantly growing KeHE's business with new accounts. This key growth leader will work with the KeHE cross functional teams to drive new sales growth by cultivating, managing, and closing major pursuits in targeted retail accounts. Enablers of success in this hunter-oriented position include, strong sales acumen, a high-level of competitiveness, ability to build and leverage relationships with retailers, suppliers and brokers, strong leadership skills and process orientation.
Essential Functions
DUTIES, TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Work with leaders of KeHE's sales channels and BD teams to build and execute strategies for growing KeHE's Grocery, Fresh and Exclusive Brands businesses with new customers.
• Close $50-$60M in new business annually.
• Operate within established budget expectations.
• Develop and maintain a high degree of insight into competitors' strategies and programs.
• Attend professional meetings, trade shows and seminars to build relationships and surface new sales leads.
• Implement and report on established business development processes to ensure consistency, documentation and compliance.
• Develop effective customer correspondence, proposals and presentations.
• Maintain safe work practices.
• Maintain safeguards of confidential company information.
• Other duties as assigned.

SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:
• Results-Driven - Strong desire and ability to deliver results.
• Competitive Resolve - Possessing a competitive spirit that is not easily discouraged or daunted, and the perseverance to work around obstacles and find ways to win.
• Strong work ethic - Willing to work significant hours each week with a minimum of administrative support, including approximately 30% overnight travel.
• Customer-orientation - A core belief that understanding and delivering on the needs and preferences of retailers must be at the core of KeHE's growth strategy.
• Change Agency - Having a tendency to challenge the status quo to drive change.
• Leadership Ability - Possessing natural leadership qualities, evidenced by a bias for action and the ability to influence people.7
• High IQ and EQ - A comfort level with rigorous relational and analytical demands of working with customers and internal stakeholders on complex financial and technical business issues.
• Challenger Selling - The ability to engage clients persuasively through dialogue that seeks to first understand clients' perspectives, teach them something about their business that they don't already know and tailor KeHE capabilities to their specific situation.
• Prospecting- have a proven track record of strong customer prospecting and industry contacts.
• Executive Credibility - The ability to understand what senior-level decision-makers value and the confidence to engage executives in ways that demonstrate big picture insight, expertise, vision and confidentiality.
• Relationship/Partner Building - The ability to establish credibility and connection leading to a desire by client and internal contacts to pursue long-term, mutually supportive relationships.
• Financial Analysis - The ability to understand and analyze client and KeHE financial statements and link analyses to a compelling financial case for KeHE services.
• Competitive Positioning - The ability to position KeHE capabilities and offers in a competitively advantageous light.
• Sales Administration and Reporting - The ability to efficiently manage the administrative requirements of the role and develop and complete timely, accurate reports as required by management.
• Service Attitude - Drive and desire for significance through service to others.
• Communication Skills - Ability to speak, write and present ideas, plans and information in a persuasive and compelling manner.

Minimum Requirements, Qualifications, Additional Skills, Aptitude
• Bachelor's degree.
• Minimum eight (8) years of experience in sales, grocery retailing and merchandising is a plus.
• Minimum five (5) years of experience in new Business Development with a track record of success.
• Minimum 5 years of experience at a single employer.

Requisition ID
2023-21881
Equal Employer Opportunity Statement
KeHE Distributors provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits all forms of discrimination and harassment on the basis of race, color, religion or faith, sex, gender, age, ancestry, national origin, mental or physical disability or medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, military or veteran status, genetic information, or any other category protected under federal, state, or local law. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training as well as the administration of all Human Resources and Talent Acquisition processes.
